title.narrative: EDUCATION SECTOR S CAPACITY

description.narrative: Education sector's capacity to legislate, plan, budget for and implement reforms related to access to quality early education and retention of children in primary and secondary levels is strengthened., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Education sector's capacity to legislate, plan, budget for and implement reforms related to access to quality early education and retention of children in primary and secondary levels is strengthened.

sector.narrative: Digital learning materials and ICT in education
ECD advocacy and communication including campaigns
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Ending violence against women and girls
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education sector’s capacity to legislate, plan, budget for and implement reforms related to access to quality early education and retention of children in primary and secondary levels is strengthened.

description.narrative: In 2019 significant progress was achieved in the framework of educational policy. Several actions contributed to the achievement of the results, from the exercise to align the vision of education with the international ODS commitments, to the integration of pre-school development to the elaboration/updating of policy planning instruments. In this context UNICEF and supported the government in revising and endorsing the charter of the educational policy and the sector plan 2019-2023, in implementing the action, aimed at guaranteeing access and improving the quality of education for all children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
Availability of an Education Management Information System that transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees
Education Sector Policy/Plan with quality prevention and response mechanisms to address gender based violence in and around schools
Existence of a well-functioning examinations system
Existence of an regulated effective early learning policy with clear budget allocation in place
Existence of a national Education Contingency plan
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
